content.content: MIP#: <# to be assigned> Title: BFF Partnership with GnosisDAO Author(s): Karpatkey Tags: template Type: general Status:  Date Proposed: 2022-06-22  Simple Summary The proposal detailed below has already been approved by the GnosisDAO, we’d just need MakerDAO’s approval as well to make it happen! GnosisDAO and MakerDAO are naturally aligned with DAI as a common denominator. Gnosis Chain uses bridged DAI as its gas token so DAI’s adoption is critical for the success of the network. Gnosis Ltd has already started buying MKR aggressively in the open market so it makes sense to align efforts with the GnosisDAO. Therefore, we propose the following:  Propose a token swap GNO-MKR of around $70 million to the Maker community Explore the use of an institutional MakerDAO vault with the GnosisDAO treasury using GNO + stETH and mint 100 million DAI to be used for the development of the Gnosis Chain Explore a GNO grant with MakerDAO growth core unit to expand global adoption and brand awareness of Gnosis Chain Rebranding xDAI to DAI Increase GNO incentives to DAI pairs on Gnosis Chain Periodically buy MKR in the open market using GnosisDAO’s treasury farming rewards   Abstract GnosisDAO and MakerDAO both share a vision of using DAI to build a decentralized digital global economy that is fair, transparent and efficient. MakerDAO is one of the most prominent founding players in the DeFi ecosystem, broadly regarded as a blue chip DAO, and creator of DAI: one of the most solid stablecoins in the market, which has had an unwavering performance throughout all market crises so far. GnosisDAO’s vision and ethos are aligned with MakerDAO’s, and there’s an opportunity of joining forces to improve both DAO’s growth and impact in the ecosystem. All the suggested actions detailed in the Specification section of this proposal aim to strengthen cooperation between both organizations so that their efforts yield better results.  Motivation If MakerDAO joins forces with GnosisDAO to carry out DeFi promotional efforts, including social media communication, technical articles authoring, brand awareness, etc, there would be a synergical advancement of those efforts’ impact, resulting in a significant increase in user adoption and positioning improvement, benefiting the DeFi ecosystem in general and both DAOs in particular.  Specification We propose carrying out the following actions:  Carry Out a Token Swap We would propose in both Gnosis’ and MakerDAO’s forums the execution of a large token swap of around $70MM, including incentives to maximize user adoption, approached as follows: The token swap between Maker (MKR) and Gnosis (GNO) would be used to create a liquidity pool in several Liquidity Protocols on Mainnet and Gnosis Chain. MKR/GNO pools will reward liquidity providers with GNO. Both DAOs would commit to a vesting period of 2 years. Token swaps have several benefits:  Treasury diversification Economic incentives to strengthen the bonds between both organizations and foster collaboration Increase the number of DeFi applications (staking, liquidity provision, etc.) for both DAOs, using the received tokens without selling them Increased liquidity of the tokens in different protocols.   Institutional MakerDAO Vault We’d explore the use of an institutional MakerDAO vault funded by the GnosisDAO treasury using GNO + stETH and mint 100M DAI to be used for the development of the Gnosis Chain. This could potentially result in a lower and more stability fee, critical for the long term planning of the Gnosis Chain funding requirements.  Provide a GNO Grant for the Global Adoption of DAI MakerDAO Growth has been doing an exceptional job in achieving massive adoption of DAI in South America, having positioned it as the stablecoin of choice among DeFi users in the region. In order to further expand DAI adoption on Gnosis Chain (which also results in overall DeFi users increase) in the entire Latin American region, we suggest exploring a grant for MakerDAO growth. Parallel to Latam’s coverage, a global expansion would be planned and executed, as detailed in the ‘Join forces with MakerDAO to Expand Global DeFi User Adoption and Brand Awareness’ point below, to foster adoption and brand awareness of the Gnosis Chain.  Rebranding xDAI to DAI xDAI, Gnosis Chain’s native token, would be rebranded to DAI. This will result in an increase of awareness of DAI among GC users and it will also reduce perceived friction of bridging DAI to Gnosis Chain.  Increase GNO incentives to DAI pairs on Gnosis Chain DAI pairs will be incentivized in the Gnosis Chain with additional GNO, rewarding their liquidity providers with different combinations of GNO to increase the DAI TVL in the network.  Periodic MKR Acquisition The MKR token would be periodically acquired by the treasury execution team aiming to hold it long term, and increase MKR’s liquidity in different DeFi instruments across different protocols and networks. Funds to acquire MKR would be taken from GnosisDAO’s treasury farming rewards.  Join forces with MakerDAO to Expand Global DeFi User Adoption and Brand Awareness This cooperation efforts will be distributed to the most efficient actors in improving brand awareness of both DAOs, expand the DeFi user base and increase DAI’s TVL across networks.  Social Media Publications will be made by official MakerDAO and GnosisDAO accounts to improve positioning of both DAOs, their products and tokens.  Multi-channel Advertising Collaboration efforts with cryptocurrency exchanges will allow them to increase the impact and reach of their multi-channel advertising campaigns, that aim to increase DeFi user base, DAI adoption and brand awareness of Gnosis and MakerDAO.  Co-branding and Article Publishing Technical articles about both DAO’s products and solutions would be co-authored and published online, showing both their logos.  Real-life and Online Events, Presentations and Interviews Members of both DAOs will join efforts to participate in conventions, podcasts, interviews, presentations, etc. to raise awareness about their solutions (individual and collaborative), mentioning both DAOs and displaying both logos when applicable (for joint projects).  Rationale The main reason behind all joint efforts is to leverage the synergy that both DAOs could achieve, taking into consideration that both organizations have several common goals such as DeFi user base expansion, DAI adoption and technical improvements, evolution of the ecosystem and an increase in DeFi user friendliness to catalyze massive migration from TradFi to DeFi. MakerDAO has been considered given their trajectory in the ecosystem, the quality of their products, their evolution, brand awareness and the alignment of their vision with Gnosis’.
content.GPT-summary: The post proposes a partnership between GnosisDAO and MakerDAO to promote DeFi and DAI adoption. The proposal includes a token swap, institutional MakerDAO vault, GNO grant, rebranding xDAI to DAI, increasing GNO incentives to DAI pairs on Gnosis Chain, periodic MKR acquisition, and joint efforts to expand global DeFi user adoption and brand awareness. The post is an advertisement for the proposal and explains the suggested actions in detail. It also extends the proposal to MakerDAO and invites constructive criticism.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party or author is advertising proposal
Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: Hundreds of millions of dollars in DAI deposits are held on Gnosis Chain bridge, which is precariously secured by a multisig with unprovable security. Multisigs get compromised. Bridges get drained. Bad things that are antithetical to MakerDAO’s principles can happen when this type of attack surface is willfully present. I’d suggest that MakerDAO should avoid encouraging the DeFi community to bridge DAI to Gnosis Chain until it reaches a stronger level of decentralization.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal

content.content: Welcome! Agree Maker and GnosisDAO + GC are a good fit together. We should discuss the numbers, but overall I think there are synergies to benefit both DAOs.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party extending to proposal
3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: In the past, the xDAI chain (now Gnosis Chain) offered a competitive advantage compared to Ethereum mainnet because it used proof-of-authority which is much lighter weight than proof-of-work. However, now that Ethereum mainnet and Gnosis Chain both plan to move to proof-of-stake, I’m not sure what the competitive advantage of Gnosis Chain will be. It’s neat that Gnosis Chain uses DAI for gas, but is that enough of a difference to ensure wide adoption? Is there a long-term theoretical advantage that Gnosis Chain has over Ethereum mainnet? Both chains seem equally constrained by storage. This partnership might have made sense two years ago, but now I’m not sure.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal

content.content: Welcome @Karpatkey and thanks for this proposal. Leveraging synergy between the DAOs makes a lot of sense. My main issue is that a $70m token swap is absolutely massive (almost 10% of MKR’s circulating supply). Surely, as BFFs, Maker and Gnosis can work towards some of these mutually beneficial ideas (co-sponsored grants, an institutional vault etc) without tokens needing to change hands?

content.content: Just to follow up on my previous point, case in point… today, Harmony bridge (also apparently secured by multisig) was hacked for $100m.   twitter.com    Harmony 💙 @harmonyprotocol  1/ The Harmony team has identified a theft occurring this morning on the Horizon bridge amounting to approx. $100MM. We have begun working with national authorities and forensic specialists to identify the culprit and retrieve the stolen funds.  More 🧵   11:13 PM - 23 Jun 2022           1.3K                490            How is Gnosis bridge more secure than Harmony?  Why should MakerDAO encourage DeFi users to use these multisig-secured bridges if their funds are being put at risk?

3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: It would not be possible to drain the Gnosis Chain bridge as it currently has daily limits, even if the multisig is compromised. We understand this solution is suboptimal, but it will change soon with the current GIP-57, an implementation for SNARK-enabled bridges for Gnosis Chain. https://forum.gnosis.io/t/gip-57-should-gnosis-dao-support-research-of-a-zksnark-enabled-light-client-and-bridge/5421
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: Gnosis has now long-standing work relationships with several teams from the Ethereum ecosystem that were not available to the xDAI team 2 years ago. This means some innovative implementations to improve Gnosis Chain are coming to fruition. Some competitive advantages of Gnosis Chain:   Most decentralized side chain. Over 100k validators run by hundreds of operators. GC has the only other relevant beacon chain.   Validator set will be leveraged for bridge security to Ethereum. Gnosis Chain will have the most secure bridge to Ethereum. This is GIP-57.   Efficiency frontier of EVM chains: Gnosis Chain will be using the most advanced EVM clients allowing to increase the gas limit beyond what Ethereum does today without sacrificing decentralization. Other side chains are highly centralized compared to GC.   Client diversity: Gnosis Chain will have at least 2 implementations with dedicated teams (nethermind and erigon) for the execution layer and 2 for the consensus layer. Most side chains only rely on geth.   Account abstraction: Gnosis Chain clients will integrate account abstraction natively allowing much more sophisticated user interactions: seedless onboarding, automation and recovery of user accounts will be possible. This can be a game changer for retail adoption. So far no side chain has account abstraction but zksync and starkware are experimenting with it.

Maker shouldn’t be putting any protocol-owned funds at this kind of elevated risk. This should be picked back up once bridge security improves.

content.content: This proposal does not include putting any Maker owned funds on the Gnosis Chain. @ChrisBlec

I agree a $70m token swap is probably too much and subject to changes. The main goal for such a large proposal was to evaluate the Gnosisdao’s commitment. I see a token swap this way:  It makes the treasury more resilient against a potential MKR bear market, if we consider uncorrelated assets. Right now GNO is heavily backed by ETH as most of Gnosisdao’s treasury is ETH. It gives the treasury influence and aligns incentives with friend protocols. More stakeholders defending MKR’s interests More types of tokens mean more opportunities for farming. LPs, loans, which could translate to potentially larger MKR buybacks. It reduces the concentration of MKR holdings within the Makerdao and it improves MKR’s distribution, a long standing issue of MKR. Divestiture aversion: In behavioural economics, it is considered communities are more willing to value and retain a token if they already have it. Once treasuries own MKR, they will become part of Makerdao and treasuries are natural long term partners.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: I see quite some potential in such kind of a cooperation. MakerDAO has to get out of the comfort zone. There are new possibilities and chances for the protocol. I just looked into GIP-57 and I clearly see some good oppertunities the DAOs should talk about. Competitors like Compound and AAVE are not sleeping, they are working on their own chain (Compound Chain), RWA implementations and stablecoins (CASH, GHO). We can expect that our D3Ms revenues are going to shrink at some point. MakerDAO should always look for new opportunities and partners in this space. The GnosisDAO has a highly skilled team and Gnosis Chain commited itself to the Dai, this could be a huge opportunity. Btw. paying fees in a stable asset is a huge advantage and MakerDAO could bring this advantage a bit closer to the Ethereum ecosystem… always remember, if MakerDAO isn’t doing this first, Compound will.

content.content: Thank you for this @Karpatkey - would you consider splitting this proposal into subproposals? For instance, quite transparently, there wouldn’t be enough MKR in the treasury to execute a transaction of the size you’re describing at current levels. I’d see this as  Treasury Swap IV a. stETH only b. GNO + stETH Co-branding alliance  Of course, we cannot encourage or prevent GnosisDAO from acquiring MKR on the open market. If you do, would be great to see you engaged in governance.     Karpatkey:  Institutional MakerDAO Vault We’d explore the use of an institutional MakerDAO vault funded by the GnosisDAO treasury using GNO + stETH and mint 100M DAI to be used for the development of the Gnosis Chain. This could potentially result in a lower and more stability fee, critical for the long term planning of the Gnosis Chain funding requirements.   On vaults - stETH is available already and I encourage you to get in touch with @Growth-Core-Unit to discuss IVs. Only thought is for a GNO vault, would be great to hear about your openness to some sort of minimum backstop and ensure a base level of utilization of the vault.

content.content: Hi from GovAlpha @Karpatkey. I agree with Nadia that separate proposals probably make the most sense. However, if you wanted, you could make each proposal conditional on the other proposals being accepted if you want them to be linked. So, for example, a token swap proposal will only progress to completion if the institutional vault is approved and vice versa. Or you can leave them all separate, up to you. Re: the token swap, it would be useful to gauge the source of the MKR tokens you envision. Are they coming from the protocol treasury? Being bought on the market using the surplus buffer? Being bought over time using DssKiln? Being minted? The community will likely have different opinions depending on which method of obtaining the MKR tokens is proposed.
